We are currently recruiting highly qualified candidates, whose background and career goals meet our needs, for the following position in our Huntsville, AL facility. Please note that due to our Department of Defense contract requirements, U.S. CITIZENSHIP IS REQUIRED.

Position Title: PMO Quote Analyst

Job Purpose: To provide accurate, detailed and professional quoting and labor estimations.

Specific Duties and Responsibilities: Responsible for Manufacturing Engineering's inputs in the preparation and coordination of Request for Quotations (RFQ's) for materials components, subassemblies and/or services based on quote requirements received from various departments within the organization (i.e. Program Management, Sales). Analyzes quotations for content in addition to preparing complete costs analyses within Manufacturing Engineering Department. Defines Manufacturing Engineering's labor estimates, NRE, needs, clarifies discrepancies and determines the structure of BOM. Monitor RFQ through process and resolve issues that come up. Complete costing information including generation of costed BOM's, identifying exceptions and assumptions, and identifying and documenting all unique costs and issues. Responsible for supplier selection, make/buy decisions, interfacing with sales and customer to resolve issues. At the highest level, may also be responsible for watching technology trends and preparing cost reduction and other recommendations based on those trends.

Knowledge and Skills: Bachelors degree and minimum of 5 years experience.

Sanmina is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we believe that diversity is critical to our success. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.SDL2017

The One Brave Idea (OBI) team in Brigham and Women's Hospital (BWH) is comprised of leading professionals from multiple disciplines working together to understand the earliest stages of coronary heart disease. OBI is exploring how CHD develops and how we can stop it from leading to heart attacks and strokes.

OBI is currently seeking a full-time Backend Software Engineer to enhance storage systems and APIs to support compelling, safe and usable clinician/researcher applications in our growing Genomics Program. The scope of this role will include responsibility on data integrity, processing data at scale, serving content to the frontends, integrations with internal and external systems, and end-to-end testing. The backend software engineer will be working closely with other engineers, as well as computational, experimental and clinical genomicists.

JOB SUMMARY

As Technical Lead for our client, you  ll ideally have several years of experience in a similar leadership role, coupled with strong, hands-on technical ability with embedded software (ideally using Java, Android, and possibly C++). Our client is a fast-paced, customer-focused consulting business, so you  ll need to be instinctively hard-wired to innovate, communicate and lead by example in all that you do; providing a first-class service to your team and a wide variety of customer stakeholders.

You  ll remotely support one of our technical teams based in Poland; attending regular scrum meetings and providing day-to-day support and mentoring for team members. The time difference means that these meetings can happen early   often around 6 am Pacific Time   so you  ll need to be flexible in your approach to work and time management. You  ll spend most of the day working on-site with the customer, meaning that communication and relationship-building are of paramount importance in this role.

As a key customer liaison, you  ll need to excel at explaining complex ideas and issues, as well as documenting highly technical projects, systems and solutions, for both internal and external use. A key member of our US-based team, you  ll drive the technical direction of projects for a new generation of streaming TV products in an Agile environment. This will involve working with developers, system engineers, architects, testers and project managers to ensure the successful delivery of a project from a technical perspective. You  ll work in a relaxed, entrepreneurial environment and will have the freedom to create great solutions and awesome outcomes every day, while working at the cutting-edge of embedded technology.

QUALIFICATIONS FOR THE ROLE 




	Embedded software (C++, C, or Java) development experience

Real-time operating systems experience

Multi-threading experience

Debugging or problem-solving experience in a Linux environment

An established track record of Technical leadership on embedded software projects, coupled with strong hands-on technical skills

Excellent knowledge of C++ or Java in an embedded Linux or Android environment

Strong debug and problem-solving skills using the latest tools

Experienced developing and debugging multi threaded and/or multi process code

Ability to communicate at all levels from developer through technical and/or business executives using appropriate language to translate business objectives into technical terminology and vice versa

Set-Top box experience would be an advantage, but not essential

Previous experience as a Scrum Master and/or Product Owner

Previous Technical Leadership and/or team management would be highly desirable

With 57 offices and 800+ attorneys, Jackson Lewis is seeking a Sr. Associate (Non-Compete Specialist) for the Cleveland, OHoffice.

The ideal candidate will also be detail oriented, have superior interpersonal, analytical and writing skills. Commitment to client service is critical as is the ability to handle a fast-paced environment. Job Description:

Employer ranks in the top 40 on LinkedIn's 2017 "Top Companies" list. We offer challenging and meaningful problems, a collaborative culture, and support for your career goals and growth.

We are seeking talented Software Engineers to join our team in enhancing our live streaming video applications and services, which are in active use by our global customers. This opportunity could be located in Dayton, OH or Charlottesville, VA.

JOB SUMMARY:

You will help build and maintain our live streaming video applications for video analysts. Because our team works with a variety of languages (C++, Java, Javascript, Python) and technologies (Docker, Puppet, NiFi, etc), we are less concerned with specific skills than proven technical problem solving abilities. Help us achieve our vision: sub-second latency for live video delivery and playback in both desktop and browser-based clients, with pluggable, horizontally scalable backend components supporting ingest, variable bit rates, and analyst workflows.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:



Design, develop, and debug mission critical software source code.
Participate in the full software development lifecycle.
Research and integrate new technologies into our development and production systems.
Write and prototype API specifications for Test-Driven Development.
Serve as technical lead for small projects and mentor other engineers.
Work on the hardest open problems in live-streamed video.


REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:- Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field and a minimum of 5 years of software engineering experience (experience may be considered in lieu of a degree).- Strong proficiency using at least one high-level programming language (Java, C++, etc.).- Knowledge of Agile Development methodologies.- Familiarity with basic web technologies including HTML, CSS, XML, SOAP, WSDL, REST, JSON, and JavaScript.- Demonstrable problem solving skills.

SECURITY CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS: U.S. citizenship and the ability to obtain a TS/SCI clearance.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:



Experience with Test-Driven Development.
Familiarity with at least one Relational Database Management System (Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, etc.).
Familiarity with NoSql databases (Apache Accumulo, MongoDB, etc.).
Experience with Spring or video transcoding.
Prior work or hobbyist projects with ffmpeg, libdash, or angular.js.
QT and/or web graphical user interface development experience.

Role DescriptionOur Dropbox Infrastructure Engineering team is passionate about building awesome products at massive scale. We've developed a set of values that enable us to do this. Specifically, we write great software and sweat the details, focus on impact, and create an enduring culture. Building elegant products begins with lots of hacking and iteration to explore the problem space. It culminates in careful attention to edge cases and error handling, polished code, and great tests to ensure that we ship reliable code that never compromises data integrity or security. Every Dropbox software release improves millions of lives, and you'll find a high petabyte-to-engineer ratio here. We're bold when it comes to shipping high-leverage projects, even if they're risky or novel. We care deeply about collaboration, feedback, and iteration. Trust and respect are deeply rooted in our engineering culture. At the heart of Dropbox lies the largest networked filesystem in history. We routinely take on audacious challenges, often against competitors who have 10-50x our resources. On top of this foundation, we're creating products that enable people to do amazing things with their stuff across all their devices. We hope you'll join us!Responsibilities



You will build infrastructure to handle metadata for hundreds of billions of files, hundreds of petabytes of user data, and millions of concurrent connections
You will scale Dropbox as the data-fabric which connects hundreds of millions of the world's apps, devices, and services
You will measure and optimize as Dropbox continues to build one of the industry's most advanced analytics platforms to derive meaning from vast amounts of data.


Requirements



BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding (e.g., physics or mathematics), or equivalent technical experience
2+ years of professional software development experience
Extensive experience building and owning large-scale, multi-threaded, geographically distributed backend systems
Highly skilled at developing and debugging in C/C++, Java, or Go
Knowledge of Python a plus
Experience with operating system internals, filesystems, databases, network, compiler also a plus
Familiarity with Linux


Benefits and Perks



100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage
401k + company match
Market competitive total compensation package
Free Dropbox space for your friends and family
Wellness Reimbursement
Generous vacation policy
10 company paid holidays

The Company

Gas Pos is solving two major problems for truck stops & gas stations.

Due to the EMV Mandate of 2020, 80% of gas stations & truck stops must replace their point of sale systems. Even worse, becoming EMV-Compliant at the pump would cost them significantly as they need to replace gas pumps, costing roughly $15,000 each.

Our EMV Card Readers are a technological breakthrough for the fuel industry. Our POS system is free & includes free installation. Were a fast-growing, venture-backed startup, and wed like to speak with you.

Were based in North Little Rock, Arkansas, and you must be willing to relocate to the Little Rock area.

Why We Started

We built this company because we have seen over the last 10 years how changes in payment regulations, by the major banks, and card brands have devastated small business owners. Over the next 3 years, 4.2 billion dollars will be spent by the owners of your local corner store to accept chip cards at the pumps. Some of the stores will spend hundreds of thousands of dollars, and others will be forced out of business.

The Opportunity

We need programmers who are looking to shake up the gas station & truck stop industry by building cutting-edge technology. Were launching multiple products in the coming months, and if you want to be part of one of the fastest-growing companies in the South, Gas Pos is the choice for you.

Position Summary

The Research Analyst is responsible for assisting senior research staff (economists), in developing, maintaining and analyzing a longitudinal database for the place-based initiative. The individual will work closely with senior research staff to combine the various datasets needed to create a "cradle-to-career" database for Kalamazoo. The individual will also support other related research conducted at the Institute.

Duties and Responsibilities

Assist senior research staff in the development of longitudinal databases. Analyze data to help researcher gain better understanding of how individuals transition along the lifelong continuum. Develop data to assist key groups in the region in setting priorities for meeting the challenges faced by those individuals. Provide support in generating exhibits to be integrated into reports. Perform other duties and analytic tasks as assigned.

Job Requirements and Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in economics, mathematics, computer science or related field. Master's degree a plus. Technical writing regarding data sources, variable definitions and other data set design issues may be required.

Advanced knowledge of modern database architecture, analytic frameworks and methods, machine learning concepts and applications and predictive analytic experience necessary. Experience and demonstrated ability in statistical analysis using STATA and R preferred, as well as relevant Microsoft Office software.

All interested candidates must submit a cover letter, resume and list of references by November 7, 2018 to be considered.

This position is based on a grant received by the City of Kalamazoo to work on Place Based Initiatives.

At Amplitude, we're building analytics that helps our customers use data to build better products and drive growth. We're already the analytics platform of choice for many top product teams around the world including Microsoft, Square, and Hubspot. Job Description:

Technology Protection Engineers (TPEs) work in the Army Research and Technology Protection Center (ARTPC). The TPE researches and analyzes Research, Development, and Acquisition (RD&A) engineering and programmatic documentation and facilitates Integrated Product Teams (IPTs) to help identify Critical Program Information (CPI). CPI is defined as a U.S. capability element that contributes to the warfighters' technical advantage, which, if compromised, undermines U.S. military preeminence. Once CPI is identified, the TPE works with program engineers, security, and counterintelligence personnel to assess threats to the technology, identify risks, and recommend protection measures which help ensure U.S. Soldiers maintain technological overmatch of their adversaries on the battlefield. The TPE also aids in identifying the critical functions of the technology in order to initiate the Supply Chain Risk Management activities which ensure malicious logic and counterfeit components are not present in the weapon system.

A successful TPE candidate needs to possess a general knowledge of engineering principles and the ability to self-study and research a wide range of advanced technology. Once hired, the candidate will be trained in RD&A and Program Protection activities. Upon successful completion of the training program, they will be certified as a Technology Protection Engineer by the ARTPC.

This junior position is in Huntsville, AL, and works with a team of more senior personnel in Alabama and throughout the ARTPC team in multiple US locations. The successful candidate will work well individually and as part of a team, take direction and complete assignments, complete individual study and research and report findings back to a team or document them in an individual or group report, to include identifying gaps and recommending mitigation measures.

External Referral Eligible

Required Skills (Knowledge, Skills, Abilities)

Basic understanding of engineering principles

Excellent oral and written communication skills, problem solving skills, analytical skills

Working Knowledge of Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Excel

Group facilitation skills

Strong analytical and problem solving skills

Ability to multitask

Public Speaking in a group facilitator or trainer role

Travel

Must be willing to travel up to 10% of the month

Required Qualifications

TS/SCI, Bachelors in Engineering with 3 years experience.

Desired Skills

Prior experience in government/Army development, testing, experimentation, or acquisition programs

Previous experience in Business / Systems Analysis/Product Owner

Previous experience in Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) and Content Management System (CMS)

Proven experience in eliciting requirements, creating user stories, test cases, and wireframes



Experienced in analyzing data to draw business-relevant conclusions and in data visualization techniques and tools. Documenting systems design, creating specifications, flow charts, and other related diagrams based on user or system design specifications.


Advanced knowledge in generating process documentation

Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills

Preferred CBAP (Certified Business Analyst Professional) or PMI-PBA (PMI Professional in Business Analysis).



Strong understanding of Agile and Waterfall Processes as well as SDLC processes.

Our problems are common yet complex. Bloomberg's application teams face challenges of large-scale data storage, low-latency retrievals, high-volume requests and high availability over a distributed environment. We are creating standardized solutions to these problems by building core services and technology frameworks for enterprise-wide use.

You will help us build the Bloomberg Data Platform (BDP). BDP is an initiative to help standardize the storage back ends and structure data flows across our systems to improve discoverability and data provenance.

All of Bloomberg's data flows through these systems. While building high-performance, low-latency, scalable software for these core infrastructure initiatives, you'll learn about our financial datasets and how they're used. We work with diverse technologies including Spark, Kafka, Hbase, Hadoop and the entire cloud deployment stack for large scale production datasets.

Take ownership of a component of the Bloomberg Data Platform
Interact with development teams across Bloomberg and understand their application requirements and access patterns
Design and develop systems that meet our latency, volume, storage and scale expectations
Participate in daily scrums to help influence architectural decisions
Work with containers (docker/ Kubernetes)


You'll need to have:



5+ years of experience programming in Java
Knowledge of Spring , Spring Boot, Spring Cloud, Kubernetes, Docker

Amazon Web Services (AWS) provides companies of all sizes with an infrastructure web services platform in the cloud. With AWS, you can requisition compute power, storage, and other services paying as you go for only the resources you need. Amazon Redshift is rapidly growing, fast and powerful, fully managed, petabyte-scale data warehouse service in the cloud. It enables customers to dramatically increase their query performance when virtually any size data set using the same SQL-based business intelligence tools they use today. They can launch a fully operational service with a few clicks for as low as under $1000 per terabyte per year. Amazon Redshift manages all the work needed to set up, operate, and scale a data warehouse, from provisioning capacity and installing software to monitoring and backing up the cluster, to applying patches and upgrades. By automating these labor-intensive tasks, Amazon Redshift enables customers to spend their time focusing on their data and business insights, rather than on procuring and managing infrastructure.

Description

The Business Banking Risk Quality Assurance (QA) Credit Analyst is responsible for oversight and testing of the Underwriting function to ensure adherence to credit policy, risk appetite and regulatory guidance. The program operates in the second line of defense and requires the full re-evaluation of sampled loans with issues tracked and communicated to executive management.

This position requires strong, collaborative, and cross functional partnerships to ensure that identified deficiencies are remediated in a timely manner.

Responsibilities:



Prepare executive summary of findings with recommended corrective actions, challenge 1st line of defense corrective action plans and monitor execution of corrective action plans.
Periodically review underwriting procedures to test for accurate
representation of credit policy and intended execution of strategies designed by the 2nd line of defense credit risk organization.
On-going input into the design and maintenance of the QA Program in order to ensure underwritten loans conform to credit policy, risk appetite and regulatory guidance.
Evaluate sampled loans leveraging both randomized and targeted techniques. Loan level reviews include, but are not limited to, recalculation of qualifying income and general conformance to Credit policy.
Perform independent reviews and testing of first line of defense control environment including QA programs to ensure proper controls exist to identify and control risk taking within the underwriting function.


Qualifications



Bachelors or Equivalent.
At least 5 years' experience in commercial underwriting, portfolio management or credit administration.
Technical Qualifications - Bach degree in Finance, Economy, Business Administration or equivalent work experience.
Strong working knowledge of Business Banking Loan policies and procedures.
Technically proficient, execution focused, with strong business acumen.
Strong working knowledge / industry expertise of regulatory matters related to business banking/commercial lending.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, understanding/competency in regulatory matters and compliance, preferably concentrated in retail credit risk functions, retail loan review, regulatory environment or consumer lending.
Flexible & adaptable to competing and changing priorities
Strong technical skills with proficiency in MS Office suite, SQL, SAS.

Have you considered what it may be like to work for Pratt & Whitney? We have a rare opportunity for a talented Staff Engineer, Mechanical Design to support the development of our world-class compression systems located in East Hartford and/or Middletown, CT.

Responsibilities/Accountabilities:

As a Mechanical Design Engineer, you design compression system hardware that meets or exceeds part and system requirements. You will work collaboratively to tackle problems with integrated product teams and system design teams, and are responsible for all aspects of the design and executing to standard procedures. Craft new part designs
Execute major and minor Engineering Changes (EC's)

Collaborate with all supporting disciplines including Aerodynamics, Heat Transfer & Secondary Flow, Structures, Engineering Dynamics & Loads, and Manufacturing.
Assist in leading the team through product design and manufacture phase.
Drive the concurrent design of multiple components, interpreting analysis results for accuracy and proposing alternate solutions


10% travel is required

Job Description, Required Skills, Education, Experience:

Materials Analyst

The role of the Material Analyst is to provide data to help in the management of the SS&M business. Steel is the single biggest cost in the SS&M business as such we need to have full visibility into the total impact on the business. This includes our: projected steel consumption by specification; projected costs; projected recoveries; and volume of generated scrap. This data will require analysis and what if scenarios evaluation. The Material Analyst will build the required data base and generate much of the required analysis to support the business decisions.

Specific duties include, but are not limited to:

Build Excel files.

Work with program teams and plants to build by part number a master steel data base:

o Part number

o Part description

o Gross weight

o Net weight

o Steel category

o Steel specification

o Planned volume

o Actual volume

Understand Market Indexes

Model OEM Indexing agreements

Model cost impacts based on planed consumption

Model scrap generation

Data analysis

Four Year College Technical Degree (Finance or Business desired)

Foreign language skills highly desired.

Good computer skills, i.e., MS Office, Excel, HFM, CI Trac.

Interpersonal and teamwork skills.

Occasional travel required

Four Year College Technical Degree (Finance or Business desired)

Candidates with a Finance Degree
Background with Excel / Data Analysis Manipulating lots of data. A lab setting working with data analysis would be a good fit as well.
Steel industry experience is preferred but not required.


Possible local travel to other plant locations to better understand the scope of the business and role development.

OverviewAirborne Interactive is seeking individuals to join our in-flight entertainment applications development division. The division develops and integrates interactive software applications and graphical user interfaces for seat back entertainment systems on commercial aircraft worldwide.

We are a small company and anyone looking for the structure and slow moving pace of a larger corporation will not find what they are looking for with us.

Purpose of Job

The Program Manager is responsible for the relationship between Airborne Interactive and our clients to liaise with the worlds leading airlines and lead the design and execution of their passengers inflight entertainment experience. This role is also responsible for the account and project management of interactive software delivery.

Responsibilities

The role is responsible for maintaining regular dialogue with appropriate client representatives regarding current and future programs. The Program Manager is responsible for capturing the requirements, articulating the customer requirements back to the Airborne development teams, negotiating delivery time frames and managing the expectations of our clients regarding delivery of the software.

  Management of all aspects of the airlines passenger graphical user interface (GUI) from requirements gathering to final customer acceptance testing and deployment.

  Generate and maintain project schedules, action lists, status reports and track to completion

  Participate in program reviews, customer meetings, software validation, verification and formal testing.

  Communicate with clients to ensure definition and clarity of requirements is understood or negotiation of alternative dates or solutions when required.

The NISC III program within the Civil group at Leidos is seeking a Primavera Project Scheduler / Management Analyst to gather and analyze data for various FAA systems/plans. These systems include the FAA's CWP (Corporate Work Plan), LDR (Labor Distribution Reporting), and E2 (Travel) systems. The Corporate Work Plan is an FAA system for managing the full lifecycle of programs associated with the establishment, modernization, and sustainment of the National Airspace System (NAS) and its infrastructure. Labor Distribution Reporting involves collecting data on the time FAA employees, managers, and executives. Work on projects and activities; determining the cost of the time; and providing management reports on the time and cost against projects and activities. Information derived from the LDR process allows all FAA managers and employees to better understand staff resources required for achieving agency goals and objectives. Specific duties for the position include: Named Resource Assignments (to include adding/removing roles as appropriate) i.e. what resources (such as labor and materials) are needed to do the work, whether all required resources will be available when needed, and whether any funding or time constraints exist. Corporate Work Plan Responsibility Assignment Matrix (RAM) analysis/input i.e. Describing the roles and responsibilities of various government and contractor team members in fulfilling the tasks related to the identification of important work elements or tasks necessary to execute the program. Resource loading analysis which will result in learning if teams and individuals are over/under loaded. Tableau report analysis, LDR/E2 charging analysis, Reporting progress, as requested

LeadGen

LeadGenAnalyst

The NA Consumer Economics team uses Economics, Statistics, and Machine Learning to understand and influence the complex economy of Amazons 3rd party sellers. We are particularly interested in candidates with experience building predictive models and working with distributed systems.

We are one of North America s largest independent manufacturers of consumer packaged goods ( CPG ), KIK helps a large portfolio of brands and retailers bring their products to life. The Business Analyst is responsible for reviewing, prioritizing, modifying and recommending business requirements applied to our databases and systems under the direct oversight of the Business Process Director. In addition, this role will pinpoint how Exotic can leverage its strengths and improve its weaknesses through various business process improvements and through the use of technology or software. Review, prioritize and propose business process improvements across all departments within the organization.

Time and project management and prioritization skills a must. Demonstrated success in leading projects to close on time, within budget and within scope. Able to understand the customer's needs and position a solution which best addresses all of the customer's needs.

Strong problem solving and decision making skills.

Description

The Operations Research Department within the Undersea Systems Office (USO) at The Applied Research Laboratory at Penn State (ARL) is seeking a Software/Visualization Engineer with a desire to apply skills to real-world analytical problems in research and development through system assessment and tool development. The successful candidate will have expertise in tool/technologies/architectures that support visualization of data in both 2-D and 3-D. Responsibilities include: develop and maintain software baseline for tool development GIS tool/technologies (ESRI, ARCGIS, Quantum GIS, Cesium, OGC) and 3-D Gaming (Unity); maintain proper version control of software deliverables; communicate consistently and effectively (both oral and written) with peers, management, and stakeholders; work in all phases of the development lifecycle, designing software architectures, developing software applications. This job will be filled as a level 1, level 2, or level 3, depending upon the successful candidate's competencies, education, and experience. Typically requires a Bachelor's degree or higher in an Engineering or Science discipline (Professional Engineer license accepted in lieu of Bachelor's degree) or higher, or an equivalent combination of education and experience for a level 1. Additional experience and/or education and competencies are required for higher level jobs. Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or Math/Statistics is preferred. A Master's Degree preferred. Preferred experience includes: interfacing with databases, physical simulation development, coding for computational efficiency in optimization or Monte-Carlo simulation problems and Human-Machine Interface (HMI) design. Previous military experience, especially with undersea systems is beneficial. Experience with the following is required: scientific programming for modeling and problem solving (e.g. MATLAB, Mathematica, R, Python, C/C++, C#, Java or similar languages); familiar with Atlassian products (JIRA, BITBUCKET, Confluence); user interface development GIS tool/technologies (ESRI ARCGIS, Quantum GIS, Cesium, OGC); 3-D Gaming (Unity). Candidates will be subject to a government security investigation. You must be a U.S. citizen to apply. Employment with the Applied Research Laboratory will require successful completion of a pre-employment drug screen. These are one year, fixed-term renewable appointments.

Job DescriptionFinancial Analyst

Reports To: VP Finance and CFO

Job Overview

Ensure the integrity of financial information for this generics pharmaceutical company by analyzing, verifying and reconciling accounting and financial data. Must have experience in the pharmaceuticals industry, particularly in the areas of gross to net sales accounting and customer chargebacks, discounts, rebates and deductions. Requires a keen attention to detail, and the ability to effectively function in a fast-changing business environment. Northern New Jersey location.

Responsibilities and Duties

  Analyze and prepare reconciliations of the accounts receivable portfolio. Develop procedures to improve the efficiency of these reconciliations as data volumes increase. Interface with Sales & Marketing management to gain an understanding of the underlying agreements and pricing.

  Partner with the Companys third-party logistics provider in providing oversight on cash remittance application and input on wholesaler deductions. Support the commercial side of the business with analyses as needed.

  Prepare monthly bank reconciliations and periodic cash flow forecasts to support assessments of the Companys funding requirements.

  Support the preparation of financial forecasts and budgets. Assemble and summarize data to structure sophisticated reports on financial status and risks.

  Provide general accounting support, and obtain documentation and prepare reconciliations for audits.

Qualifications

  Bachelors degree in finance, accounting, business or related field.

  Experience in pharmaceutical finance/accounting required (minimum of 3 to 5 years). Need to be familiar with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (US GAAP) and financial statements.

  High level of proficiency with Excel required (e.g., VLookups, Pivot Tables, etc.). Proficiency with desktop database software (Access) and Presentation software (PowerPoint) a plus.

  Familiarity with computerized financial systems required. Experience with QuickBooks a plus

Job Description:Global manufacturing client located in Troy, MI is looking to fill a Sr. Tax Analyst job that will be responsible for assisting in the quarterly and year-end financial statement tax accounting, consolidated federal and state income tax returns, sales and use tax returns, franchise tax returns, property tax returns, and other miscellaneous compliance returns. This position will support all financial aspects of the international holding company structure and may be assigned certain treasury functions as needed.   YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES: * Ensure the company is following federal and state and income tax regulations, as well as all property tax, sales and use tax, business tax and all other taxes. Ensure all tax returns are filed in a timely and accurate manner. * Calculate and coordinate estimated tax payments. * Process financial and accounting data as well as other information to identify and bring forward substantive tax issues and determine the appropriate treatment of items. Identify potential planning opportunities and/or advocacy positions. * Assist in documentation of tax processes and retention/organization of tax information. * Calculate monthly/quarterly tax provision. * Prepare ASC 740 calculations and financial statement tax footnote. * Interact with other department personnel on tax issues, such as human resources, financial controllers, and payroll. * Coordinate gathering/dispersing information necessary for engagements with external advisors. * Coordinate gathering/dispersing information during tax audits. * Maintain holding company general ledgers.   QUALIFICATIONS: * Bachelor s degree in finance, accounting or related field and at least 4 years of tax, accounting and compliance experience. * Master s Degree and CPA preferred. * Prior experience in both the public accounting arena and a corporate tax department preferred. * Strong tax compliance and processes is required.   * Strong knowledge of federal and state tax laws along with some exposure to ASC 740 is required. * A solid knowledge of payroll and individual taxes as they affect corporations.   * Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Exposure to SAP BPC.

Founded in Pittsburgh in 1976, our mission at R.G. Brewton, Inc. is to deliver value-added integrated supply chain services to the manufacturing sector. Tooling Configuration Analyst Summary: The candidate will be responsible for correcting and maintaining design documentation for production tooling. This includes the maintenance of bills-of-materials, incorporation of Engineering Change Orders, revising assembly models and drawings, eliminating redundant information and archiving obsolete design files. Duties also include correcting or updating design documentation to reflect the as-built configuration of the tool. Participation will be required with the implementation of a Product Data Management solution. Essential Function/Duties and Responsibilities: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function/duty satisfactorily. Other duties/functions may be added or assigned. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Review and correct production tooling documentation and ensure its file structure follows the guidelines defined in the Tool Design File Management Structure SOP and that information is properly stored in each folder. Delete any reductant administrative or design documents. Incorporate Engineering Change Orders by modifying part models, subassembly models and insert them into the assembly model of the tool. Revise 2D drawings affected by ECOs and ensure they are connected / associative with their solid models. Update Bills-of-Materials affected by changes. Archive previous designs that have been revised by Engineering Change Orders. Participate in the implementation of Product Data Management software / system. Formulate and incorporate ECOs for undocumented design changes. Visit Inlines manufacturing Plants to reconcile tooling documentation to the as-built configuration of the tool. Other duties as assigned. Required knowledge and skills Skilled in 3D solid modeling software; preferably Solidworks. Knowledgeable in Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing. An understanding of design configuration management of mechanical assemblies. A good mechanical aptitude and the ability to work with mechanics hand tools if necessary. Knowledge of the manufacturing environment involving plastic processes is beneficial. Proficient in the use of Microsoft Word, Excel. Good verbal and written communication skills. Ability to work in a fast paced, flexible environment. Education and/or Experience - Two year degree from a college or university with 2-4 years mechanical design experience and working with detailed assemblies. Or a one year degree in Computer Aided Drafting and Design (CADD) Technology with 3-5 years of mechanical design experience working with detailed assemblies. Candidates with injection molding or thermoforming tool design or plastics industry experience is beneficial. Tool making or machine shop experience is beneficial.

Through dedicated collaboration with the scientific and engineering communities, and as one of the top three R&D investors in the life science tools industry, the brand serves as a strategic partner to customers and helps advance the promise of life science.

Supporting the assigned Franchise and Commercial Organizations toward building their strategies, incl. preparing management presentations and designing/driving strategic projects

Analyzing internal data (sales, web metrics, operational KPIs, other) to identify performance trends & opportunities, and to inform strategic direction

Leveraging secondary sources and interfacing with primary market research colleagues & to analyze market trends, to identify potential opportunities

Supporting strategy execution tracking of key initiatives

Experience supporting multi-stakeholder projects and teaming within a matrix organization

Highly collaborative, flexible and team-oriented

Strong problem-solving, written & verbal communication skills

Amazon Influencer Program is looking for an experience Sr. Software Development Engineer who can play a pivotal role in guiding the engineering future of our program.

Amazon Associates is the world s largest affiliate program. It s success has been built on a rich selection of websites and blogs, all creating original content relevant to products sold on Amazon. With the meteoric rise of social media, a new segment has emerged   Influencers. Influencers are either famous in their own right (sports, music, movie stars) or social media stars, but they all have one thing in common   they are tastemakers with hundreds of thousands or millions of followers. Our team manages the Amazon Influencer Program, which gives influencers an easy way to earn money by referring traffic to Amazon from social media. Our long team vision is to grow the program into a premier influencer marketing program connecting influencers with brands, as brands are increasingly adopting marketing strategies that incorporate a wide range of influencers to drive sales.

The business analyst is the individual who has the primary responsibility to elicit, analyze, validate, specify, verify, and manage the real needs of the project stakeholders, including customers and end users. The business analyst is also known as a requirements analyst, requirements engineer, requirements manager, system analyst, or simply analyst. The business analyst serves as the conduit between the customer community and the software development team through which requirements flow.

A business analyst is involved at some level throughout the entire system or software development life cycle. Upon establishment of the requirements baseline, the focus is shifted towards the management of the requirements specification and verifying the fulfillment of all requirements.

The business analysis function is a project role, not necessarily a job title. The role may be performed by a dedicated BA or split among multiple team members who have other primary job functions, such as a project manager, product manager, or developer. The BA is responsible for seeing that the tasks are performed properly.

At Amazon Web Services, we like to "work backwards": start by understanding what customers need and using that to guide our software engineering. We're looking for software engineers passionate and experienced in listening to customers, synthesizing their needs, and rapidly iterating our services to quickly put features into customers' hands. Our best ideas become even better when we get feedback from real customer use. The sooner we can get that feedback, the more quickly we can grow.

Customers using AWS Direct Connect establish high capacity connections between their existing IT infrastructure and the AWS cloud, enabling seamless integration and inter-operation of the two infrastructures. We listen closely to what customers tell us they need in networking services and work to deliver. Whether it's a new DX network location, an improvement to an existing feature, or a radically new idea, we have consistently executed to deliver on these ideas.

Amazon has a fast-paced environment where we "Work Hard, Have Fun, Make History." On a "typical" day, software engineers might whip up a prototype to prove or disprove an idea, instrument code to report a new metric, talk with customers, code up a feature, or draft a proposal for a radical new idea.

For detailed info regarding Direct Connect visit:

http://aws.amazon.com/directconnect

They say that a picture is worth a thousand words. Assuming those words come from a Army National Guard Imagery Analyst, those words could protect the lives of U.S. personnel in the field.

National Guard Imagery Analysts provide information about enemy forces and potential battle areas to leadership. This information is absolutely necessary to plan for our national defense. In this role, you will work with other intelligence specialists to gather and study images and information required for designing defense plans and tactics. You will analyze aerial and ground photographs, as well as electronic imagery of foreign ships, bases, missile sites, and industrial facilities. You will also identify enemy weapons and equipment defenses, and study land and sea areas that could become battlegrounds in time of war.

Join the Guard as an Imagery Analyst and your training could prepare you for a future with Government agencies that collect, record, analyze, and distribute tactical and technical intelligence information or in other fields, such as research, business planning, surveying, or cartography. You'd most likely be qualified to work for engineering, mapmaking, mining, land evaluation, and construction companies.

Earn while you learn

Instead of paying to learn these skills, get paid to train. In the Army National Guard, you will learn these valuable job skills while earning a regular paycheck and qualifying for tuition assistance.

Job training for an Imagery Analyst requires 10 weeks of Basic Training, where you'll learn basic Soldiering skills, and 21 weeks of Advanced Individual Training and on-the-job instruction, including practice in intelligence gathering. Part of this time is spent in the classroom and part in the field.

Requires military enlistment. Applicants must meet minimum qualifications. Actual MOS assignment may depend on MOS availability. Benefits subject to change.

Benefits/Requirements Benefits


  Paid training  A monthly paycheck  Montgomery GI Bill  Retirement benefits for part-time service  Low-cost life insurance (up to $400,000 in coverage)  401(k)-type savings plan  Student Loan Repayment Program (up to $50,000, for existing loans)  Healthcare Benefits AvailableRequirements


  High School Diploma or GED  Must be between the ages of 17 and 35  Must be able to pass a physical exam and meet legal and moral standards  Must meet citizenship requirements (see NATIONALGUARD.com for details)

Most non-prior service candidates will earn between $196.26 and $254.91 per drill weekend.

Programs and benefits are subject to change.

This position may qualify for a bonus, ask your National Guard recruiter for the most up-to-date information.

In this role, you will be a key contributor to Facebook's data center energy strategy and your responsibilities will include: tracking and forecasting data center energy usage and cost, performing sensitivity and scenario analyses, and monitoring US energy market trends. Additionally, you will help drive the development and deployment of Facebook's global energy strategy in an effort to create a cost competitive clean and renewable energy based supply portfolio that meets the company's overall strategic objectives. You will be expected to become an expert on the energy rates and usage for Facebook's growing portfolio of data centers. Although this role is not focused on renewable energy analysis, exposure to renewable energy generation and financial modeling is a plus. Excellent communication, presentation, and analytical skills are a must. This position is full-time and located in our Menlo Park office.

RESPONSIBILITIES



Serve as an expert on energy rates and usage for Facebook's growing portfolio of data centers


Create and maintain models to forecast energy usage and analyze electric rate impacts for current and future data center sites

Deliver monthly and annual summaries of key energy metrics to the Global Energy team and internal stakeholders

Engage with Infrastructure stakeholders to track data center design and capacity engineering trends to improve load forecasting methodologies and support energy efficiency efforts

Work with Energy Managers to analyze possible rate structures for new data center locations

Work with Sustainability team to provide data on Facebook's energy usage and renewable energy procurement

Work with utility and internal partners to ensure timely bill payment and resolve billing issues as needed

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS



Bachelor's degree in a business, finance or technical discipline


3+ years of work experience with an electric utility, financial institution, energy supplier, renewable energy project developer, or energy intensive consumer

Experience in analyzing and interpreting energy usage data, electric tariffs, and wholesale energy market data

Excel experience and experience with data sets

Experience in developing and maintaining partnerships with suppliers and internal stakeholders

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS



Experience working with electric utilities


Experience with Tableau or other data visualization software
